Articles.Content:
Hello all!

I was wondering if there was a way to get the Career/Science option of looking at where you took reports/data in Sandbox mode.

Can you mod this?

Thanks, DMSP

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-18T19:21:56Z" title="04/18/2015 07:21  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 18, 2015</time> by DMSP**
  
Made it clearer
You could start a Science mode game, and just give yourself enough science to unlock everything at the start. It'd be the same thing.

> 
> You could start a Science mode game, and just give yourself enough science to unlock everything at the start. It'd be the same thing.

Well, I guess.

Problem is I have a lot of crafts and missions going on.

Some I can spare, like my ComSats, but others, like my AAR Jool explorer, I can't.

> 
> Problem is I have a lot of crafts and missions going on.
> Some I can spare, like my ComSats, but others, like my AAR Jool explorer, I can't.

You can also convert your existing sandbox game to Science mode. Something like [this](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/86622-How-to-import-a-0-23-5-Career-save-into-0-24-Science-Mode).

> 
> You can also convert your existing sandbox game to Science mode. Something like [this](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/86622-How-to-import-a-0-23-5-Career-save-into-0-24-Science-Mode).

If this works this is probably your best bet - sandbox games don't save or even report any science in your persistent.sfs, so without changing the game mode the game itself won't even know.

> 
> If this works this is probably your best bet - sandbox games don't save or even report any science in your persistent.sfs, so without changing the game mode the game itself won't even know.

Yeah, ok!

I'll try it but also play it safe by having my normal save as backup.
